channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: CPB agrees to revive a $36 million deal with NPR killed after Trump's pressure
item.description: The Corporation for Public Broadcasting agreed Monday to fulfill a $36 million, multi-year contract with NPR that it had yanked after pressure from the Trump White House.
item.content:encoded:
The Corporation for Public Broadcasting agreed Monday to fulfill a $36 million, multi-year contract with NPR that it had yanked after pressure from the Trump White House.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik/Getty Images and Phil McCarten/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: The U.N. Security Council approves a U.S. plan for a Gaza stabilization force
item.description: The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.
item.content:encoded:
The plan authorizes a security force in the devastated territory and envisions a possible path to an independent Palestinian state. Russia, which had circulated a rival resolution, abstained along with China on the 13-0 vote.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: FEMA acting chief David Richardson departs after 6 months on the job
item.description: The acting chief of the Federal Emergency Management Agency has left his post, marking another disruption in a year of staff and policy changes. His leadership was questioned after he delayed responding to deadly floods in Texas.
item.content:encoded:
The acting chief of the Federal Emergency Management Agency has left his post, marking another disruption in a year of staff and policy changes. His leadership was questioned after he delayed responding to deadly floods in Texas.

(Image credit: Noah Berger)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why some ant colonies get tricked into killing their own queens
item.description: For some would-be ant queens, the easiest way to take over a colony is to dupe its worker ants into committing regicide.
item.content:encoded:
For some would-be ant queens, the easiest way to take over a colony is to dupe its worker ants into committing regicide.

(Image credit: Joachim K. Löckener, CC BY-SA 3.0)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: Ecuador rejects U.S. military bases in major defeat for President Noboa
item.description: Ecuadorians have decisively rejected a series of referendum measures, including plans for U.S. military bases and constitutional changes, handing President Daniel Noboa a major political setback amid rising gang violence.
item.content:encoded:
Ecuadorians have decisively rejected a series of referendum measures, including plans for U.S. military bases and constitutional changes, handing President Daniel Noboa a major political setback amid rising gang violence.

(Image credit: Dolores Ochoa)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Bangladesh's ousted prime minister sentenced to death for role in protest crackdown
item.description: A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India and was sentenced in absentia.
item.content:encoded:
A tribunal in Dhaka sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death for her involvement in the use of deadly force against protesters last year. She fled to India and was sentenced in absentia.

(Image credit: Rajesh Kumar Singh)
item.dc:creator: Shamim Chowdhury

item.title: Trump changes stance on Epstein files. And, the U.S. increases pressure on Venezuela
item.description: President Trump changes stance on the Epstein files, urging Republicans to support a House vote tomorrow. And, the U.S. military buildup in the Caribbean adds pressure on Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump changes stance on the Epstein files, urging Republicans to support a House vote tomorrow. And, the U.S. military buildup in the Caribbean adds pressure on Venezuela.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Dementia housing without locked wards? It's a small but growing movement
item.description: Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.
item.content:encoded:
Some senior living communities are caring for people with dementia alongside other residents, not segregated behind locked doors.

(Image credit: Ashley Milne-Tyte)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Milne-Tyte

item.title: With 'Baby Botox,' young adults strive to keep wrinkles from ever forming
item.description: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.
item.content:encoded: A growing number of 20-somethings are trying to freeze time with preventative Botox treatments. Here's what's behind the trend.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Boden

item.title: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling schools. It wants underfunded districts to take them on
item.description: Rural school district superintendents are trying to find the best use of limited resources. Taking on the state's unmaintained buildings, they say, will only increase their burden.
item.content:encoded:
Rural school district superintendents are trying to find the best use of limited resources. Taking on the state's unmaintained buildings, they say, will only increase their burden.

(Image credit: Gabby Hiestand Salgado)
item.dc:creator: Emily Schwing
